data.title: Load anchor points from plist files
data.body:
This change allows loading anchor points from sprite sheet plist files. The default behaviour is not changed. 

The anchor point is set only if an **anchor** entry is found in the plist file for a specific sprite. 

```
   <key>anchor</key>
   <string>{1,0.5}</string>
```

The new anchor point feature also works with animation frames taken from the sprite sheet.

This change is required to use TexturePacker's upcoming pivot/anchor point  editor with cocos2d-x and should also work with other sprite sheet tools (if they implement such functionality).

Issues with new Label on Nexus 6P - Huge FPS drop & Lag
data.body:
The problem is with new label system. No issue with old LabelTTF. Getting 60fps

We tested new Label with TTF & BMFont. Both have FPS issue.

ui::TextBMFont, ui::Text & LabelBMFont also have the same fps issue.

http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/serious-lag-fps-issue-on-nexus-6p-marshmallow/25622

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
[Issue 14677]Fix Downloader bug on iOS 9 that treats 403 Forbidden response as success
data.body:
On iOS 9 when server returns a response with HTTP status 403 caused the
downloader to callback successfully and saving the error message to the
storage path. This commit adds a check on the HTTP status code and
do failure callback if status code is 4xx or 5xx.

> This bug is due to the different behaviour of NSURLSession on iOS 8 and iOS 9 runtime. This commit makes them behave alike.
> 
> This is a fix for https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/14677

data.title: Immediate crash during init with 2 monitors connected to iMac
data.body:
I have a crash directly while launching the "hello world" app on my iMac.

Cocos2d: 3.9
XCode: 7.2
MacOS: 10.11.2
Hardware: Retina iMac 27", 2nd Monitor

The app runs without any problems as soon as the second monitor is disconnected.

The code that's executed until the crash:

Main:

```
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
    AppDelegate app;
    return Application::getInstance()->run();
}
```

AppDelegate: initGLContextAttrs

```
void AppDelegate::initGLContextAttrs()
{
   GLContextAttrs glContextAttrs = {8, 8, 8, 8, 24, 8};
    GLView::setGLContextAttrs(glContextAttrs);
}
```

AppDelegate: applicationDidFinishLaunching

```
bool AppDelegate::applicationDidFinishLaunching()
{
    auto director = Director::getInstance();
    auto glview = director->getOpenGLView();
    if(!glview) {
#if (CC_TARGET_PLATFORM == CC_PLATFORM_WIN32) || (CC_TARGET_PLATFORM == CC_PLATFORM_MAC) || (CC_TARGET_PLATFORM == CC_PLATFORM_LINUX)
        glview = GLViewImpl::createWithRect("Cocos2dx-SpriteSheetTutorial", Rect(0, 0,  designResolutionSize.width, designResolutionSize.height));
#else
        glview = GLViewImpl::create("Cocos2dx-SpriteSheetTutorial");
#endif
        director->setOpenGLView(glview);
    }
}
```

The rest is in cocos2d-x.

The crashlog:

```
#0  0x00007fff9e5e3152 in strlen ()
#1  0x00007fff9e628a54 in __vfprintf ()
#2  0x00007fff9e6516c9 in __v2printf ()
#3  0x00007fff9e635915 in _vsnprintf ()
#4  0x00007fff9e6359ca in vsnprintf ()
#5  0x00000001005f3c72 in _glfwInputError ()
#6  0x00000001005f9aab in _glfwPlatformGetMonitors ()
#7  0x00000001005f3e75 in glfwInit ()
#8  0x0000000100572af8 in cocos2d::GLViewImpl::GLViewImpl() 
#9  0x0000000100572b35 in cocos2d::GLViewImpl::GLViewImpl() 
#10 0x00000001005739e4 in cocos2d::GLViewImpl::createWithRect(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, cocos2d::Rect, float) at /Users/sk/Programming/_test_and_tutorials/Cocos2dx-SpriteSheetTutorial/Project/cocos2d/cocos/platform/desktop/CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp:312
#12 0x0000000100001f89 in AppDelegate::applicationDidFinishLaunching()
#13 0x00000001005c47e9 in cocos2d::Application::run() 
#14 0x0000000100003996 in main 
#15 0x0000000100001274 in start ()
```

data.title: Downloader on iOS 9 treats 403 Forbidden response as success
data.body: This bug is due to a change of behaviour of NSURLSession on iOS 9 runtime. ### How to reproduce Create a file task with a URL pointing a non-existing resource on an existing server, and the server should return a 403 status code. Our server also returns a response xml string like this: ``` AccessDeniedAccess Denied3B4257EFABACF8C2jAsg+mkGyWMO8nOuYbNY16UHBGiHQx4UervcMecHSehgMow5lnP8IsHGxj9U3NuM6EBMf/o7VbM= ``` ### Result On iOS 8, this response will pass a `You do not have permission to access the requested resource` error, while on iOS 9 it will just save the above xml data into the specified storage path, treating the task as successful. ### Have I fixed this? Probably yes, on my app I added a few lines of code to check the response's status code, and it seems to working properly. I will clean up the code and make a PR a few days later once the change is proven to be OK.

data.title: Remove duplicate allocation to fix memory leak
data.body:
The `action` is created at line 954 of `CCActionTimelineCache.cpp` but `ActionTimeline::create()` has already been called at line 949.

``` cpp
949: ActionTimeline* action = ActionTimeline::create();
950: 
      ...
953:
954: action = ActionTimeline::create(); // memory leak
```

There is a memory leak here, and this patch fixes it, thanks.
